column1: #Text=[0303]The compound of Example 46 (2.88 g) was dissolved in dichloromethane (100 mL).
#Text=To this solution, triethylamine (4.51 mL) was added, followed by addition of anhydrous trifluoromethanesulfonic acid (2.97 mL) at 0.degree.
#Text=The mixture was stirred at room temperature for 1 hour.
#Text=Subsequently, the reaction was terminated by adding water and the mixture was extracted three times with ethylacetate.
#Text=The organic layer was washed with saturated brine and dried over sodium sulfate.
#Text=Evaporation of the solvent under reduced pressure and purification by silica gel column chromatography (hexane:ethyl acetate=20:1) afforded the title compound as a yellow oil (4.25).
